species.name: Bardottan
species.description: Bardottans are a saurian species, with scaled skin. Their lower legs bend backward, and they walk on three-toed feet. Their forearms are shorter than their lower extremities and end in three fingers and a thumb. Their long necks are heavily wrinkled and can bend in any direction. A beak-like snout dominates their head. Bardottans vary substantially in height at maturity, ranging from just over a meter to more than two meters tall. Their skin tones range from pale gray to yellow, green, and even purple. Some have a consistent tone across theri bodies, but other have distinctive markings, including striped and spotted patterns.
